snippet: Nine Afghan police officers were killed as they slept on Wednesday, and a 10th was suspected of assisting Taliban insurgents in the attack.
abstract: Afghan policeman on late-night guard duty at a checkpoint in the Oruzgan Province allows Taliban insurgents to enter and kill nine other policemen as they slept in their beds; episode is yet more evidence of the challenges the United States faces as it prepares Afghans to take over their own security ahead of the end of NATO's combat mission in 2014.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, Farooq Jan Mangal from Khost and an Afghan employee of The New York Times from Kabul.
